paragraphs.text:
%md

#Introduction
In this demo, there is an Oracle database, Hadoop with Sqoop (Data loading), Hive (Data Transformation) and HAWQ (Advance analytics)

1. I will load data from Oracle to Hive by using Sqoop

2. I will transform data and show simple BI features

3. I will show some simple MADlib function of HAWQ to train a model and run prediction

result.msg:
Introduction

In this demo, there is an Oracle database, Hadoop with Sqoop (Data loading), Hive (Data Transformation) and HAWQ (Advance analytics)

  1. I will load data from Oracle to Hive by using Sqoop

  2. I will transform data and show simple BI features

  3. I will show some simple MADlib function of HAWQ to train a model and run prediction

paragraphs.text:
%md

#Extraction and Load

Sqoop is easy to use, we use `sqoop import` for data extraction and load into Hadoop, with `--connect` `--username` and `--password` to specify source database parameters.
`--table` for source table name
`--where` for the where clause if any
`--hive-import` for import into Hive
`--hive-overwrite` for overwriting Hive table


Sqoop creates table automatically in Hive, which save a lot of effort to rewrite DDL from source to Hive format.

--table for source table name

--hive-overwrite for overwriting Hive table

Sqoop creates table automatically in Hive, which save a lot of effort to rewrite DDL from source to Hive format.

paragraphs.title: Sqoop for VDWH_POL
paragraphs.text:
%sh

sqoop import --connect jdbc:oracle:thin:@//10.128.91.40:1521/chkp_rac  --username niki_ng --password apri2016 \
  --table 'CAS.VDWH_POL' \
  --where  "BILL_TO_DT between '01-JAN-10' and '31-JAN-10'" \
  --hive-import --split-by POL_NUM

paragraphs.text:
%md

#Transformation
###Simple Transformation by joining few tables and save as a new table

result.msg:
Transformation

Simple Transformation by joining few tables and save as a new table

paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql

drop table if exists pol_plan_clm_amt

create table pol_plan_clm_amt as
select 
    a.pol_num, a.plan_code, a.clm_num, b.clm_amt, b.clm_bnft_amt, 
    c.pol_stat_cd, c.bill_day, c.mode_prem, c.lyr_mpre, c.div_bal, 
    c.bill_mthd, c.pmt_mode, c.grp_no, c.div_opt, c.pd_to_dt, c.pol_reiss_dt, 
    c.ipo_ind, c.iio_ind, c.iio_percentage, c.pol_trmn_dt, c.uwg_clas, 
    c.prem_paid_total, c.db_opt, c.no_of_coverage, c.source_of_business, c.crcy_code,
    c.pol_app_dt, c.pol_iss_dt, c.pol_eff_dt, c.orig_pol_eff_dt, c.par_code, 
    c.no_lapse_gurt_ind, c.auto_rebal_opt, c.mpre, c.paid_up_add, c.oyt_amt, c.rcc_ind,
    c.mortality, c.open_flag, c.coll_bank, c.prc_ind, c.line_of_bus, c.sngl_prem_ind,
    c.pdf_bal, c.pdf_rate, c.prod_cat, c.plan_code_base, c.vers_num_base, c.sa_cd_2, 
    c.wa_cd_1, c.wa_cd_2, c.gurt_bnft, c.gurt_amt, c.life_incm, c.rmn_gurt_amt, 
    c.rmn_life_incm, c.anty_opt, c.anty_freq, c.anty_ref_dt, c.anty_payo_amt, 
    c.dist_chnl_cd, c.owner_type, c.inf_yr, c.inf_mth, c.rpc_ind, c.payor_dth_dt, c.chnl_ind,
    c.morbidity, c.owner_nationality, c.insured_nationality, c.owner_res_city, c.insured_res_city,
    c.owner_id_doc_typ, c.insured_id_doc_typ, c.special_clas, agt_code, convrt_fr_pol, 
    c.mvy_ded_to_dt, c.reins_mthd, c.bill_to_dt, c.pmt_susp, clm_bnft_amt > prem_paid_total as loss
from 
    hcatalog.cas.tclm_dtls a,
    hcatalog.cas.tclm_dtls_payout b,
    hcatalog.cas.vdwh_pol c
where
    a.clm_num = b.clm_num and
    c.pol_num = a.pol_num

result.msg:
Update Count
0

paragraphs.text:
%md

#BI

paragraphs.title: Top 20 plans with most claims
paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql

select * from (
select plan_code, sum(clm_bnft_amt) as amt 
from pol_plan_clm_amt
group by plan_code
) as f
where amt > 0 
order by amt desc
limit 20

%psql.sql

select plan_code, sum(dif) from
(
select plan_code, clm_bnft_amt - prem_paid_total as dif 
from pol_plan_clm_amt 
where clm_bnft_amt > prem_paid_total 
) as f
group by plan_code
order by 2 desc
limit 20
paragraphs.title: Top 20 plans with most claim amount where > prem paid amount

%md
#Advanced Analytics

Pivotal HAWQ supports in-database advanced analytics. The build-in MADlib library provide below machine learning / statistics functions.

result.msg:
Advanced Analytics

Pivotal HAWQ supports in-database advanced analytics. The build-in MADlib library provide below machine learning / statistics functions.

paragraphs.text:
%psql.sql

drop table if exists pol_plan_clm_amt_logregr;
drop table if exists pol_plan_clm_amt_logregr_summary;

SELECT madlib.logregr_train(
    'pol_plan_clm_amt',                                 -- source table
    'pol_plan_clm_amt_logregr',                         -- output table
    'loss',                            -- labels
    'ARRAY[1, bill_day, mode_prem, lyr_mpre, iio_percentage, no_of_coverage]',       -- features
    NULL,                                       -- grouping columns
    20,                                         -- max number of iteration
    'irls'                                      -- optimizer
    )

%psql.sql

select p.pol_num,  madlib.logregr_predict(coef, ARRAY[1, bill_day, mode_prem, lyr_mpre, iio_percentage, no_of_coverage]), loss
from pol_plan_clm_amt p, pol_plan_clm_amt_logregr m
limit 10
